Course Title: Career Reengineering Program and Professional Development Workshops
Course Description: For students in the 10-month Career Reengineering Program sponsored by the School of Engineering. Limited to CRP fellows.

Fundamentals of quantitative ecology and their application towards understanding the dynamics and persistence of ecological communities-ensemble of multiple species populations. Focuses on modeling principles from single, pairs, to multiple species. Modeling covers phenomenological and mechanistic understanding through graphical, analytical, and numerical analysis. Topics include growth, different notions of stability, feasibility, exploitation and maximization of resources, pest outbreaks, perturbations, species coexistence, and experiment-to-modeling approaches among others. Concepts applicable to micro- and macro-communities.
See description under subject 5.95[J].

Course Title: Graduate Studies in Civil and Environmental Engineering
Graduate Studies in Civil and Environmental Engineering
Course Description: Individual study, research, or laboratory investigations at the graduate level under faculty supervision.

Course Title: Research in Civil and Environmental Engineering
Course Description: For research assistants in the department, when assigned research is not used for thesis but is approved for academic credit. Credit for this subject may not be used for any degree granted by Course 1.

Course Title: Teaching Experience in Civil and Environmental Engineering
Course Description:
Provides classroom teaching experience under the supervision of faculty member(s). Students prepare instructional material, deliver lectures, grade assignments, and prepare a teaching portfolio to be submitted at the end of term. Concurrent enrollment in 1.95[J] strongly recommended.
Enrollment limited by availability of suitable teaching assignments.

Course Title: Undergraduate Studies in Civil and Environmental Engineering
Course Description: Individual study, research, or laboratory investigations under faculty supervision.
See description under subject 2.EPE.

See description under subject 2.EPW.
Enrollment limited.
Program of research leading to the writing of an SM, MEng, CE, PhD, or ScD thesis; to be arranged by the student and an appropriate MIT faculty member.

Program of research leading to the writing of an S.B. thesis; to be arranged by the student and an appropriate MIT faculty member. Intended for seniors. Student must submit an approved thesis proposal to the Academic Programs Office by the fifth week of the first term the student is registered for thesis.

Course Title: Research in Civil and Environmental Engineering
Research in Civil and Environmental Engineering
Course Description: Individual research or laboratory study under faculty supervision. Also opportunities in ongoing research program.

Course Title: Special Problems in Environmental Microbiology and Chemistry
Course Description: Advanced study of topics not covered in the regular subject listings, particularly seminar, laboratory, and experimental subjects offered by permanent or visiting faculty. Addresses topics in environmental microbiology, ecological genomics, microbial evolution and population genetics, oceanography, biogeochemical processes, environmental organic chemistry and aquatic chemistry.

Course Title: Special Graduate Subject in Civil and Environmental Engineering
Course Description: Graduate subjects taught experimentally; subjects offered by visiting faculty; and seminars on topics of current interest not included in the regular curriculum. 1.978 is taught P/D/F.

Special Graduate Subject in Civil and Environmental Engineering
Course Description: Graduate subjects taught experimentally; subjects offered by visiting faculty; and seminars on topics of current interest not included in the regular curriculum. 1.978 is taught P/D/F.

Course Description: Graduate subjects taught experimentally; subjects offered by visiting faculty; and seminars on topics of current interest not included in the the regular curriculum. 1.978 is taught P/D/F/.

Course Description: Graduate subjects taught experimentally; subjects offered by visiting faculty; and seminars on topics of current interest not included in the the regular curriculum. 1.S978 is taught P/D/F.

Course Description: Graduate subjects taught experimentally; subjects offered by visiting faculty; and seminars on topics of current interest not included in the the regular curriculum. 1.S978 is taught P/D/F/.

Special Undergraduate Subject in Civil and Environmental Engineering
Course Description: Subjects taught experimentally; subjects offered by visiting faculty; and seminars on topics of current interest not included in the regular curriculum. 1.S991 is taught P/D/F.
